intro: Calyptranthes fasciculata var. hahnii, commonly known as the Hahn's clustered calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and evergreen, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
